intro: Epidendrum ensicaulon, commonly known as the golden spike epidendrum, is a tropical orchid native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its long, slender, and often pendulous inflorescence, which bears numerous yellowish-green to golden flowers. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees and other structures in its natural habitat. Its leaves are usually elongated and革质 (leathery), providing structural support and aiding in water retention. Epidendrum ensicaulon is appreciated for its ornamental value and is often cultivated for its striking floral display.
